definitions: the action of moving one's hand or arm from side to side as a greeting or signal
the motion of fabric, flags, or flexible materials moving back and forth in air
examples: The waving from the crowd showed their enthusiasm for the team
Her constant waving finally caught the taxi driver's attention
The waving of the national flag marked the start of the ceremony
We could see the waving of wheat fields in the summer breeze

definitions: solid substance made from beeswax or petroleum used for polishing and waterproofing
yellowish substance naturally produced in the ear canal for protection
gradual increase in the moon's visible illuminated portion
examples: She applied wax to the furniture to restore its original shine
The car needs a fresh coat of wax to protect the paint
The doctor removed excess wax from the patient's ear canal carefully
Ear wax helps protect the inner ear from dust and bacteria
The wax of the moon continued for two weeks until full
During the wax phase, the moon appears larger each night

definitions: cosmetic treatment involving heated wax to remove unwanted body hair from the roots
the process of applying wax to surfaces for protection or shine
the period when the moon's illuminated surface appears to grow larger nightly
examples: Her monthly waxing appointment keeps her legs smooth and hair-free
The salon offers various waxing services including eyebrow and bikini
Regular waxing of the floors maintains their glossy professional appearance
He spent Saturday morning waxing his vintage car to perfection
The waxing of the moon creates better conditions for night photography
Ancient farmers planned their planting during the moon's waxing phase

definitions: the side or edge of a road, path, or route where travelers might stop
a state of being abandoned, neglected, or no longer pursued
examples: They found a small inn by the wayside to rest for the night
Wildflowers bloomed along the wayside of the country road
Many good ideas fall by the wayside due to lack of funding
His exercise routine fell by the wayside after the busy season started

definitions: the process of becoming less strong, powerful, or effective over time
gradual decline in economic indicators, currency value, or market performance
examples: The weakening of her immune system made her susceptible to infections
Engineers noticed a weakening in the bridge's support structure
The weakening of the dollar affected international trade significantly
Market analysts predicted further weakening of consumer confidence

definitions: the process of gradually introducing a baby to solid food while reducing breastfeeding or bottle feeding
the gradual process of withdrawing from or reducing dependence on something
examples: The pediatrician recommended starting weaning at six months with soft foods
Weaning can be an emotional time for both mother and baby
His weaning from pain medication required careful medical supervision
The company began weaning itself off government subsidies

definitions: collective term for weapons and military equipment used in warfare or defense
examples: The museum displayed ancient weaponry from various civilizations and time periods
Modern weaponry includes sophisticated electronic and computer-guided systems

definitions: electronic device designed to be worn on the body for health monitoring or communication
item of clothing or accessory that is suitable and comfortable for wearing
examples: The new wearable tracks heart rate, steps, and sleep patterns throughout the day
Fitness wearables have become increasingly popular among health-conscious consumers
The designer focused on creating wearables that combine style with comfort
This fabric makes a perfect wearable for both casual and formal occasions

definitions: a person who wears or has on a particular item of clothing, accessory, or device
examples: The wearer of the crown bore great responsibility for the kingdom
Contact lenses should be removed by the wearer before sleeping

definitions: the action of having clothes, accessories, or items on one's body
the process of gradual damage or deterioration through continued use
examples: Wearing a helmet while cycling significantly reduces head injury risk
She insists on wearing her grandmother's pearl necklace to formal events
The constant wearing of the carpet created a visible path
Years of wearing had made the stone steps smooth and slippery

definitions: small, slender mammal with brown fur known for hunting rodents and quick movements
person who behaves in a sneaky, untrustworthy, or cowardly manner
examples: The weasel slipped through the fence to hunt mice in the barn
Weasels can squeeze through incredibly small spaces despite their size
Don't trust him, he's a weasel who will betray you for profit
The weasel in accounting has been spreading rumors about layoffs

definitions: television or radio presenter who reports and forecasts weather conditions to the public
examples: The weatherman predicted heavy rainfall for the weekend outdoor festival
Our local weatherman has been accurately forecasting storms for twenty years

definitions: device mounted on buildings that rotates to show which direction the wind is blowing from
examples: The old barn's weathervane shaped like a rooster still works perfectly
Sailors relied on the harbor weathervane to plan their departure times

definitions: pattern or method of interlacing threads or yarns to create fabric or textiles
zigzag movement through or around obstacles while maintaining forward motion
examples: The basket's tight weave made it perfect for holding water
This fabric has a unique weave that makes it both strong and flexible
The boxer's defensive weave helped him avoid his opponent's punches
Her weave through traffic was both skillful and slightly dangerous

definitions: person who creates fabric by interlacing threads on a loom or by hand
small bird known for constructing elaborate woven nests from grass and twigs
examples: The weaver demonstrated traditional techniques at the cultural heritage festival
Master weavers can create intricate patterns from memory alone
The weaver birds built dozens of hanging nests in the acacia tree
Male weavers construct nests to attract potential mates during breeding season

definitions: the craft or process of interlacing threads to create fabric, baskets, or other items
movement in a winding or zigzag path through or around obstacles
examples: Traditional weaving techniques have been passed down through generations
The weaving of silk requires exceptional skill and patience
His weaving through the defensive line earned him the winning touchdown
The drunk driver's weaving across lanes alerted police to pull him over

definitions: strong fabric woven in strips used for straps, belts, or support in various applications
thin membrane of skin connecting digits in aquatic animals like ducks or frogs
examples: The climber checked the webbing on his harness before ascending
Nylon webbing is commonly used in military and outdoor equipment
The duck's webbing between its toes helps it swim more efficiently
Scientists study the webbing of bat wings to understand flight mechanics

definitions: small digital video camera connected to a computer for live video streaming or recording
examples: She covered her laptop's webcam for privacy when not using it
The meeting required all participants to turn on their webcams

definitions: person responsible for maintaining, designing, and managing a website's technical aspects and content
examples: The webmaster quickly fixed the broken links reported by users
Our webmaster updates the company website with fresh content weekly

definitions: single document on the internet accessible through a web browser at a specific URL
examples: The webpage loaded slowly due to heavy traffic on the server
She bookmarked the webpage containing the recipe for future reference

definitions: V-shaped piece of wood or metal used for splitting, securing, or tightening
golf club with an angled face used for short, high shots
triangular piece cut from something round like cheese, pie, or fruit
examples: He used a wedge to split the large log into manageable pieces
Place a wedge under the door to keep it open
His sand wedge helped him escape the bunker in one shot
Professional golfers carry several wedges for different distances
She cut the cake into equal wedges for all the guests
A wedge of lemon adds the perfect touch to seafood

definitions: the state of being married as recognized by law or religious custom
examples: Children born in wedlock automatically receive certain legal rights and protections
They entered into wedlock after five years of courtship

definitions: informal term for the act of urinating, especially used with children
something extremely small in size or amount
examples: The toddler announced he needed a wee during the long car journey
She took the puppy outside for its morning wee
Just add a wee bit of salt to enhance the flavor
The cottage had a wee garden perfect for herbs

definitions: any day of the week except Saturday and Sunday, typically associated with work or school
examples: The museum offers discounted admission on weekdays to attract more visitors
Traffic is always heavier on weekdays during rush hour

definitions: person who travels or stays somewhere for weekends, especially for leisure
small suitcase or bag designed to hold clothes and items for a weekend trip
examples: The beach town fills with weekenders escaping the city heat
As a weekender, she maintained apartments in both locations
She packed her weekender with just enough clothes for two nights
The leather weekender was the perfect size for short business trips

definitions: any evening of the week from Monday through Thursday, excluding Friday which begins the weekend
examples: They avoid going out on weeknights due to early morning work schedules
The restaurant offers special weeknight discounts to boost business

definitions: the act of shedding tears, typically as an expression of grief or sadness
downward hanging or drooping growth pattern in certain trees or plants
examples: The weeping at the funeral showed how beloved she had been
Uncontrollable weeping overcame him when he heard the tragic news
The weeping willow provided shade with its gracefully drooping branches
Weeping varieties of cherry trees create stunning garden displays

definitions: small beetle with an elongated snout that damages stored grains, crops, and plants
examples: The grain elevator inspector found weevils in several storage bins
Cotton weevils caused massive crop losses before modern pest control

definitions: the process of determining the weight or mass of something using scales
the act of carefully considering or evaluating options before making a decision
examples: Daily weighing helps track progress during a fitness program
The weighing of ingredients ensures consistent recipe results
After much weighing of the pros and cons, she accepted the job offer
The judge spent hours weighing the evidence before reaching a verdict

definitions: mathematical adjustment applied to data to reflect relative importance or compensate for bias
the process of adding weight to something to achieve balance or desired distribution
examples: The survey used demographic weighting to ensure representative results
Grade weighting gives more importance to final exams than homework
The weighting of the fishing net helps it sink to the proper depth
Proper weighting of scuba gear ensures neutral buoyancy underwater

definitions: athlete who competes in the sport of lifting heavy weights in specific controlled movements
examples: The Olympic weightlifter trained six days a week to perfect her technique
Professional weightlifters follow strict nutrition plans to maintain their strength

definitions: competitive sport or exercise involving lifting heavy weights in prescribed movements like snatch and clean-and-jerk
examples: Weightlifting requires not just strength but also technique and flexibility
She took up weightlifting to improve her overall fitness and bone density

definitions: strong permanent joint formed by fusing metal pieces together using heat, pressure, or both
examples: The weld on the steel beam passed all safety inspections
A proper weld should be stronger than the surrounding metal

definitions: skilled tradesperson who joins metal parts by melting and fusing them together
machine or tool used to perform welding operations on metal
examples: The certified welder worked on the new bridge construction project
Underwater welders earn high wages due to the dangerous conditions
He bought a portable welder for his home workshop projects
The robotic welder increased production speed at the factory

definitions: industrial process of permanently joining metal pieces by melting and fusing them using heat or pressure
examples: Welding requires proper safety equipment including masks and protective clothing
The shipyard specializes in underwater welding for marine repairs

definitions: state of being comfortable, healthy, and happy encompassing physical, mental, and social aspects
examples: Regular exercise contributes significantly to overall wellbeing and life satisfaction
The company introduced wellbeing programs to support employee mental health

definitions: original and bountiful source of something, especially positive qualities like creativity or knowledge
examples: Her childhood experiences became a wellspring of inspiration for her novels
The ancient library served as a wellspring of wisdom for scholars

definitions: raised mark or ridge on the skin caused by a blow or allergic reaction
strip of material sewn between a shoe's upper and sole for reinforcement
examples: The mosquito bite left an itchy welt on her ankle
Several welts appeared after he walked through the nettle patch
The cobbler repaired the worn welt on the expensive dress shoes
Quality shoes feature a Goodyear welt for durability

definitions: boxing or mixed martial arts weight division for competitors weighing between 140 and 147 pounds
examples: The welterweight champion defended his title for the fifth consecutive time
He moved up from lightweight to welterweight after struggling to make weight

definitions: legendary creature from folklore that transforms from human to wolf, typically during a full moon
examples: The horror movie featured a werewolf terrorizing a small mountain town
According to legend, werewolves can only be killed by silver bullets

definitions: wind blowing from the west or movement in a western direction
examples: Strong westerlies brought rain from the ocean to the coastal regions
The ship took advantage of the westerly to speed its journey

definitions: person from or living in the western part of a country or from Western civilization countries
examples: As a westerner visiting Asia, she was fascinated by the cultural differences
Many westerners struggle with the spicy cuisine when first arriving

definitions: toward the west or in a western direction
examples: The pioneers traveled westward in search of new opportunities and land
The storm system moved westward across the plains throughout the night

definitions: area of land saturated with water, including marshes, swamps, and bogs that support unique plant and animal life
examples: The wetland serves as a natural filter for water entering the lake
Protected wetlands provide crucial habitat for migrating birds
